author: Toru Fujioka
description: Inflation in Tokyo sharply eased led by government utility subsidies, while still staying well above the Bank of Japan’s target, keeping it on a path toward further interest rate hikes.
title: Tokyo Inflation Slows on Subsidies as BOJ Stays on Hike Path

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to secure investment pledges from Japan of more than ¥10 trillion ($68 billion) during his two-day trip to the country, people familiar with the matter said, as he seeks to bolster the economy against soaring US tariffs.
title: Modi to Secure Japan Investment, Supply Deals During Key Visit

author: Catarina Saraiva, Amara Omeokwe, Saleha Mohsin, Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: The president is defying a consensus that powerful finance levers should be kept away from politicians as he seeks to take America’s monetary reins.
title: Trump’s Attacks Risk Wrecking the Fed’s Hard-Won Credibility

author: Irina Anghel
description: UK business confidence rose this month to its highest in almost a decade, with an increased majority of firms planning to hire more staff in the coming year despite Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ tax hikes, a survey found.
title: UK Firms Defy Tax Hikes With Plans to Boost Hiring, Survey Finds

author: Amara Omeokwe
description: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller again called for lower interest rates, saying he would support a quarter-percentage point reduction in September and anticipates additional cuts over the next three to six months.
title: Fed’s Waller Sees Quarter-Point Cut Next Month, Followed by More

author: Dan Murtaugh, Serene Cheong
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has a rare opportunity to meet with his two most important energy partners this weekend, at a time when he needs something from both.
title: Putin Meets With Modi and Xi to Thrash Out Energy Needs

author: Laura Curtis
description: What was once too much of a nuisance for the US to regulate became too big of an economic force to ignore any longer.
title: US Ends Duty-Free Parcels as E-Commerce Grows Too Big to Mail

author: Colum Murphy
description: When Xi Jinping gathers his closest international allies for one of the landmark summits of his more than a decade-long rule, many will be seeking reassurance after emerging scarred from conflicts.
title: Xi Sharpens Mission for Bloc Built to Rival US-Led World Order

author: Nathan Risser
description: The California Energy Commission is set to delay the implementation of a refiner profit cap sought by Governor Gavin Newsom, according to people familiar with the plans.
title: Newsom's Plan to Prevent Pump-Price Spikes Faces 5-Year Delay

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Jessica Nix
description: The Trump administration is tapping a deputy of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as the acting director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, after moving to oust the agency’s current head in a clash over vaccine policy.
title: RFK Jr. Taps Top Health Aide to Lead CDC After Ousting Director

author: Courtney McBride
description: The State Department approved Ukraine’s request to buy thousands of long-range missiles worth up to $825 million and funded by the governments of Denmark, the Netherlands and Norway, as well as the US, the Defense Security Cooperation Agency announced Thursday.
title: US Backs Ukraine’s Request for Missiles Paid for by NATO Allies

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s ruling Pheu Thai party is optimistic that suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra will win a court case over alleged ethical misconduct that threatens to end her tenure.
title: Thai Ruling Party Remains Upbeat Over PM’s Fate Ahead of Verdict

author: Cailley LaPara
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, transportation reporter Cailley LaPara looks at the end of a tariff exemption for low-value parcels from overseas. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: No More Free Ride for Small-Dollar Parcels as Tariffs Kick In

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is set to visit Mexico and Ecuador next week as part of a stepped-up US fight against transnational drug cartels after President Donald Trump ordered the biggest mobilization of the US military in Latin America in decades.
title: Rubio Plans Mexico, Ecuador Trip to Boost Fight Against Cartels

author: Bob Van Voris
description: The US said that President Donald Trump’s proclamation barring foreign students from entering the country to attend Harvard University was “grounded in national-security and program-integrity concerns,” and not to retaliate against the school.
title: Trump Order on Harvard Foreign Students Was Not Retaliatory, US Says

author: Lauren Clason
description: Millions of Americans may struggle to find Covid-19 vaccines this fall, and the shots they do find are likely to be more expensive after the Food and Drug Administration this week narrowed their approvals.
title: Covid Shots Could Run as High as $225 as FDA Limits Approval

author: Matthew G Miller
description: Former Major League Baseball star Mark Teixeira is running for US Congress.
title: Ex-MLB Star Mark Teixeira Launches Bid for Texas Congress Seat

author: Andreina Itriago, Eric Martin
description: US President Donald Trump is escalating his “maximum pressure” campaign against the socialist government of Venezuela with the deployment of warships, aircraft and troops to the southern Caribbean. Trump’s administration has called President Nicolás Maduro a narco-terrorist who has orchestrated drug trafficking from the highest level of government, and the US government has offered $50 million for information leading to his arrest. The naval deployment comes after Washington escalated sanctions
title: Why Trump Is Deploying US Warships Near Venezuela

author: Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei accused Argentina’s opposition of desperately trying to halt economic progress after he was pelted with stones during a campaign event amid allegations of bribery within his cabinet.
title: Milei Calls Bribery Scandal a Lie After Facing ‘Rain of Rocks’

author: Arne Delfs, Christoph Rauwald, Magdalena Del Valle
description: A meeting between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and Russia’s Vladimir Putin is unlikely to materialize, according to German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, even though it was touted earlier by US President Donald Trump.
title: Putin and Zelenskiy Won’t Meet, German Chancellor Says

author: David Voreacos, Erik Larson
description: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook’s lawyers suggested that an unintentional “clerical error” may have been behind the mortgage dispute over which President Donald Trump wants her fired.
title: Lisa Cook Suggests ‘Clerical Error’ Was Behind Mortgage Dispute

author: Robert Tuttle
description: Alberta is projecting a wider deficit for the current fiscal year as oil prices fall, denting a key source of revenue for Canada’s top energy-producing province.
title: Alberta Projects Wider Budget Deficit as Oil Prices Decline

author: Eliyahu Kamisher
description: Governor Gavin Newsom is deploying the California Highway Patrol across major cities as President Donald Trump threatened to send the National Guard to places like San Francisco and neighboring Oakland.
title: Newsom Sends State Cops to LA, San Francisco After Trump Threats

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US judge in Virginia offered one of the strongest rebukes to date of the Trump administration’s “concerted effort” to denounce and personally insult members of the federal bench who have blocked the president’s agenda.
title: Judicial Backlash Grows Over ‘Smear’ Campaign by Trump Officials

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany and Spain’s defense ministers say they are pressing to swiftly resolve disputes over the FCAS fighter jet program and move into the next development phase this fall.
title: Germany, Spain Urge Breakthrough in Stalled Fighter Jet Program

author: Godfrey Marawanyika, Ray Ndlovu
description: Zimbabwe’s main business lobby group urged the government to implement a raft of measures to reduce firms’ operating costs, and said Argentina’s reform program could serve as a template.
title: Zimbabwe Business Lobby Group Calls for Argentina-Style Reforms

author: Riley Griffin, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump threatened to inflict “substantial” tariffs on countries that impose digital taxes just days after Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg raised concerns about the levies during a White House meeting.
title: Zuckerberg Lobbied Trump on Digital Taxes Before Tariff Threat

author: Alicia Diaz, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: A Republican senator closely allied with US President Donald Trump suggested imposing additional tariffs on Norway in retaliation for a decision by the country’s sovereign wealth fund to divest its holdings of heavy-equipment maker Caterpillar Inc.
title: Trump Ally Floats Norway Tariffs Over Caterpillar Divestment

author: Fumbuka Ng'Wanakilala
description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan launched her reelection bid with her main political opponent in jail over treason charges and the candidate of the second-largest opposition party barred from vying.
title: Tanzania’s Hassan Kicks Off Reelection Bid With Opponent Jailed

author: Max Ramsay
description: The European Union said it’s following through on a demand by President Donald Trump and is putting forward proposals to remove all tariffs on US industrial goods, give preferential treatment to some US agricultural and seafood products and prolong the duty-free treatment of American lobster.
title: EU Proposes Removing Tariffs on US Goods After Trump Demand

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada appointed a new ambassador to India, a major step in the easing of tensions that erupted after officials accused the Indian government of involvement in murders and extortions on Canadian soil.
title: Canada, India Boost Diplomatic Ties as They Fight US Tariffs

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he was considering staging a national Republican convention ahead of the midterm elections, in a bid to rally support behind his party ahead of what is expected to be a hard-fought battle for control of the House of Representatives.
title: Trump Says He’s Considering Staging a Midterm Convention for GOP

author: Eric Martin
description: The US said it welcomes Europe’s plan to snap back into place sanctions on Iran over the nation’s nuclear program, while leaving open the door for direct talks with Tehran.
title: US Welcomes European Plan to Impose Iran Snapback Sanctions

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration is discussing the use of a naval base north of Chicago to conduct immigration operations, White House border czar Tom Homan told reporters Thursday.
title: White House Weighs Immigration Operations at Base Near Chicago

author: Liam Knox, John Gittelsohn, Maxwell Adler
description: As the University of California at Los Angeles works to follow other schools in reaching a deal with the White House to restore federal funding, it faces a unique complication: Governor Gavin Newsom’s crusade against the Trump administration.
title: UCLA’s White House Talks Snarled in Newsom’s Fight With Trump

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: The Swedish government is preparing a fiscal push to get the struggling economy growing again as the largest Nordic state heads into an election year.
title: Sweden Seeks Election-Year Spending Boost as Economy Idles

author: Erik Hertzberg, Mario Baker Ramirez
description: Canada’s current account deficit reached the widest on record in the second quarter as the country’s exports to the US dropped because of the trade dispute.
title: Trade War Pushes Canada’s Current Account Deficit to Record

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The Republican-led US Senate is likely to meet the ambitious target outlined by the Trump administration to fast-track Stephen Miran’s Federal Reserve confirmation before the central bank’s September rate-setting meeting, barring any procedural glitches or unexpected opposition.
title: Trump Pick Miran Is on Track for Confirmation Before Fed Meeting

author: Mariana Durao
description: Brazilian steelmaker Gerdau SA isn’t ruling out resuming plans to build a $600 million special steel project in Mexico depending on how US trade talks evolve.
title: Brazil’s Gerdau Links $600 Million Mexico Mill to US Trade Talks

author: Josh Wingrove, Olga Kharif, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The US government on Thursday began distributing gross domestic product data on public blockchains, marking the latest Trump administration endorsement of the crypto industry.
title: US Puts GDP Data on the Blockchain in Trump Crypto Push

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump moved to fire Robert Primus, a Democrat serving on the Surface Transportation Board, setting up another pivotal legal battle over his efforts to reshape independent agencies with major economic implications.
title: Trump Moves to Fire Rail Regulator as Board Weighs Merger

author: Erik Larson, David Voreacos, Zoe Tillman
description: Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook sued President Donald Trump over his attempt to fire her for alleged mortgage fraud, kicking off a historic fight over independence of the US central bank.
title: Lisa Cook Sues Trump Over Move to Oust Her From Fed Board

author: Dan Williams
description: Israeli engineers are blasting residential bomb shelters at a desert range in a bid to design better “safe rooms” based on the lessons of Hamas’s attack in 2023 and this summer’s 12-day war and missile exchanges with Iran.
title: Israel Aims for Safer ‘Safe Rooms’ After Iran and Hamas Attacks

author: Jessica Nix
description: US Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention isn’t sufficiently aligned with President Donald Trump’s agenda and it needs an overhaul, a day after the White House fired the director following an intense clash over vaccines.
title: RFK Jr. Says CDC Needs to More Closely Align With Trump’s Agenda

author: Daniel Flatley
description: The US Treasury has issued a fresh warning for banks to be on the lookout for Mexican drug cartels that use Chinese money-laundering networks to hide their profits.
title: Treasury Warns Banks About China-Mexico Money Laundering Risks

author: Andrea Palasciano, Lyubov Pronina
description: The European Union will resume talks on how to respond to the humanitarian situation in Gaza after previously failing to agree on measures to sanction Israel over its approach to the ongoing war in the Palestinian territory.
title: EU to Resume Talks on How to Pressure Israel Over War in Gaza

author: Upmanyu Trivedi
description: The UK challenged a court ruling ordering asylum seekers no longer be housed in a hotel northeast of London, a decision that threatened to derail Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s immigration policy.
title: UK Appeals Order Stopping It Housing Asylum Seekers in Hotel

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Thousands of demonstrators hurled stones and set off firecrackers in Jakarta’s second major protest this week, fueled by increasing public anger over a hefty allowance for lawmakers.
title: Thousands Clash with Police in Jakarta as Protests Intensify

author: Alan Crawford
description: France is rocked, while Italy emerges as a surprise bastion of stability.
title: Much of Europe Is Losing the Ability to Govern

author: Adelaide Changole, Ondiro Oganga
description: Rwanda received its first group of migrants deported from the US, making good on a controversial deal it struck with President Donald Trump’s administration to accept them.
title: US Sends First Deportees to Rwanda Under Controversial Deal

author: Jonathan Tirone, Ellen Milligan, Samy Adghirni
description: European powers are expected to refer Iran back to the United Nations to face the re-imposition of tougher sanctions after the Islamic Republic failed to comply with demands to negotiate with the US and allow international atomic inspectors to resume their work.
title: Iran Faces UN Nuclear Sanctions Triggered by European Powers

author: Ethan Bronner
description: Abdallah Arara has raised 11 children and worked 400 head of sheep on the same plot of land five miles east of Jerusalem for most of the past 45 years. His parents arrived in the early 1950s after Israeli troops forced them out of the Negev, a desert further south.
title: West Bank Palestinians Wait in Dread For Israel’s New Settlement

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: The longer Chile’s presidential race goes on, the higher the personal disapproval ratings are for Communist candidate Jeannette Jara, dealing a blow to a campaign built on her charisma and warm image.
title: Chile’s Communist Presidential Candidate Adds Higher Disapproval to List of Woes

author: Andrew Rosati
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s popularity ebbed in August, suggesting the momentum he gained from a trade fight with Donald Trump was short-lived.
title: Lula’s Approval Falls as Momentum From Trump Tariff Fight Fades

author: Oscar Medina
description: The conviction of former President Álvaro Uribe for witness tampering has split Colombia, with only a minority believing that the ruling was fair.
title: Poll Finds Only a Minority of Colombians Saw Uribe Trial as Fair

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: The former Prime Minister on the politics of spending.
title: Liz Truss on the ‘Doom Loop’ Engulfing the UK Economy

author: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal
description: These days, everyone is talking about high interest rates across the rich, developed world, while warning of eventual fiscal disaster. But we may have gotten an early glimpse of this anxiety in October 2022, when then-UK Prime Minister Liz Truss unveiled her mini-budget that spooked the gilt market. Well today, rates at the long end of the British yield curve are even higher. So what’s going on? Why all this angst now about UK fiscal sustainability and the economy itself? In this episode, we spe
title: Odd Lots: Liz Truss on a ‘Doom Loop’ Engulfing the UK (Podcast)

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine said it hit two Russian oil refineries, after stepping up attacks on the country’s energy sector over the past month.
title: Ukraine Says It Hit Two Russian Oil Refineries Overnight

author: Karoline Kan
description: Singapore will start classifying some substances used in vape pods as controlled drugs from next month, paving the way for stiffer penalties as the city-state steps up efforts to crack down on vaping.
title: Singapore to Cane and Jail Peddlers of Drug-Laced Vapes

author: Yian Lee, Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Taiwan’s top diplomat made a rare, unofficial visit to the Philippines on Thursday as the two sides quietly expand ties in the face of growing tensions with China.
title: Taiwan’s Top Envoy Makes Rare Philippines Visit as Ties Ramp Up

author: Olesia Safronova, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Russia unleashed a wave of drone and missile strikes on Kyiv overnight as Ukraine and its allies kept up efforts to bring an end to the conflict and provide future security guarantees for the war-torn nation.
title: Russia Unleashes Aerial Assault on Kyiv, Killing at Least Eight

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Colum Murphy, Anto Antony
description: Back in March, when US President Donald Trump was ratcheting up his trade war with China, Beijing began a steady and quiet outreach to India.
title: Secret Xi Letter Revived India Ties After Trump Tariff Barrage

author: Lauren Faith Lau, Amber Tong, Kiuyan Wong
description: After more than 150 days in court, Hong Kong’s most closely watched national security trial has come to an end.
title: Hong Kong Judges to Decide Jimmy Lai’s Fate as Key Trial Wraps

author: Tom Redmond, Niki Koswanage
description: The father of Altantuya Shaariibuu, who was murdered in 2006 by two bodyguards of the detail for officials including former Malaysian premier Najib Razak, has petitioned the courts to order a further investigation into her death.
title: Murdered Mongolian’s Father Applies to Court to Reopen Probe

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will visit China for the military parade on Sept. 3, a rare trip that would place him alongside other world leaders attending, including Russian President Vladimir Putin.
title: Kim Jong Un to Join Putin at Xi’s Military Parade in Beijing

author: Alan Wong
description: A Hong Kong official and a lawmaker have withdrawn from a Bitcoin Asia conference in the city following advice not to engage with Eric Trump, son of President Donald Trump, the South China Morning Post reported.
title: HK Official Skips Crypto Event to Avoid Eric Trump, SCMP Says

author: Heesu Lee
description: The Bank of Korea kept its policy rate unchanged, holding off on resuming an easing cycle until it sees clearer signs that financial imbalances from housing, lending and currency markets are stabilizing.
title: Bank of Korea Holds Rates Amid Concerns Over Housing, Lending
